args: The ground is more stable here, everyone.\nYou may find walking this path is easier.
Goodness, you're right. This feels almost\nlike a paved road! Thank you for scouting\nit for us.
Of course. I'm happy to be of help! If I can\ndo anything else, please don't hesitate to\nask!
Mascula looks like a kid on Dragonyule.\nGuess I'll head over to that route too, th—
Multiple inbound entities detected.\nExact number unknown. But it's a lot.
Unknown. However, based on their\nmovement patterns—
This must be the squadron of androids\nthe Faerie Kingdom restored. But why\nwere they stationed here?
And why do they move in such force?
I suspect their puppeteers don't fancy\nus getting to the Sacred Tree.
Guess that means we're gettin' close.\nBut it don't look like they're gonna let us\nsit around and parley over tea 'n crumpets!
Orders received. Commencing operations...\nEliminate all hostiles!
Agreed. And they seem unnaturally quick\nto adapt in their tactics.
Orders received. Commencing operations...\nDivide enemy forces, then strike isolated\ntargets.
The androids are receiving control signals\nat extremely close intervals.
Seems that way. Which means our enemy\nmust be...
Yes. To issue such detailed orders, the\none controlling them must be nearby.
If the master is eliminated, all subordinate\nandroid units will cease activity.
Ah! Then let's find whoever is controlling\nthose androids!
Acknowledged. Leave the scouting to me.
That's true... An android's scouting range is\nbroader than any humanoid's. I should be\nable to help here, too!
Mascula?! Wait!\nIs he gonna be okay off on his own?
Eyes front, Luca! We need you in the fight,\nnot up in your head!
(Vantage points with a full view of this\nforest battlefield are few. The most likely\noption is...)
(There atop that tree—a faerie? And he's\nholding a materium device used to control\nthe androids.)
(That's definitely our target.\nThen my next move is clear.)
Surrender at once and instruct your\nforces to cease operations.
An enemy android? Hmph.\nWho would surrender to the likes of you?
If you would cut me down, do it. My death\nwill not be the end of his noble vision!
＂His＂? I know not whom you speak of, but I\nunderstand that you fight with purpose, in\nthe service of an ideal.
Which means that you've no doubt made\nyour peace. Prepare yourself!
Why do you hesitate?\nAren't you going to kill me?
Or...can you not do it? Hah!\nThey've brought a child into battle.
Why would I? You're the one who let me\nlive. So long, faulty little doll!
I see... It was a faerie youth controlling the\nandroids.
Thank you, Mascula.\nYour keen eye saved us today.
Happy to do what little I can.\nDo you...suppose he'll attack us again?
Obviously. They know our capabilities now.\nNext time, they'll come at us armed with a\nsolid plan.
They know the terrain far better than we\ncan hope to. If they press that advantage,\nit's unclear if we can fend them off again.
I'm sorry. If I had stopped him earlier...
But I just...couldn't bring down my sword.
...It's no surprise. You've never drawn a\nblade with your own hand before.
But I'm a combat android. A host of\nattack patterns are hardwired into my\nneural circuitry...
Affirmative. You are as capable of combat\nas I. But that's talking about schematics.
You've always hesitated to hurt people.
That reluctance persisted, even after you\nresolved to fight together with me.
While you may understand and accept my\nreasons for fighting, swinging your own\nsword at someone is a different issue.
She's right. Killing someone for the first\ntime's no easy thing. It'd be weird if you\nHAD done it and just shrugged it off.
I...suppose that's true. I've shared in the\nsensation of killing through Laxi's body,\nbut...
But this is my body. And I need to\nbe able to wield a sword with my\nown hands—through my own will.
Affirmative. You wish to be helpful.\nYet you wish to show mercy to all entities.
You've vacillated between those two urges.\nBut now that you have a body of your own,\nthe time has come to find your answer.
